intro: Thesium lisowskii, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that bloom during the winter months. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its compact, bushy form makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Thesium lisowskii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
